text: It's alright, Sachin, and no actually, we get to experience all the other ones too
But I've attained a really strong interest while using Nuke and 3DEqualizer
That’s good. What kind of stuff have you tried in Nuke ?  And please free free to ask me questions about whatever you want to know :)
I've done tracking, keying, clean up basically everything
but I really want to know what's it like working at a company like DNEG
I'm so interested and I really aspire to become a compositor when I graduate

If I have to be absolutely honest , Working at a place like DNeg or any other studio that size is great once you get some experience. But it can be a bit frustrating as a fresher . Especially As a compositor , it can take a while before you actually get to comp. 
The thing with big studios is that most jobs are specialised and not the most congenial environment to acquire a wide variety of skills quickly . 
Don’t get me wrong . I’m not saying you won’t learn . Just that at a smaller studio , you end up having to wear multiple hats and doing a lot of different things that give you an edge when you go to a bigger studio because you will have a better understanding of the pipeline. 
Ultimately it depends on you style of learning . I personally like jumping into the deep end right from the beginning and working at a smaller studio let’s you do that. 
If you prefer to take it slower and gradually build up you skills then a bigger studio is more suitable . 
It’s great that you have a high level of interest 
Do you have any experience with coding ? Python scripting ? Technical compers are a rare breed so if you can code that’ll definitely bolster your profile .
